data.prayer: Spirit, help the church in the state of Marowijne to exponentially multiply disciples.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Marowijne, Suriname
data.section_summary: What beauty can God be thanked for in this photo?

data.prayer: Spirit, please give new believers a yearning to see you praised in Marowijne, Suriname.
data.verse: Declare his glory among the nations, his marvelous deeds among all peoples.

data.prayer: Father, please help good, online teachers get the gospel on YouTube and into the the state of Marowijne.
data.verse: And this gospel of the kingdom will be preached in the whole world as a testimony to all nations, and then the end will come.

data.prayer: Lord we pray you unite the 2,843 believers to pray at all times in the Spirit, with all prayer and supplication, for spiritual breakthrough in Marowijne.
data.verse: in every situation, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, present your requests to God.

data.prayer: Lord, I thank you that you will bring health and a cure to the Jew, Dutch people. Reveal to them abundance of peace and truth.
Father, you gave the church of Marowijne, Suriname the greatest shepherd of all time, Jesus. Please, help them listen to him.
data.verse: I will place over them one shepherd, my servant David, and he will tend them; he will tend them and be their shepherd.

data.prayer: Spirit, fill the 2,843 believers in the state of Marowijne with tears, because God is not obeyed by those around them.
data.verse: Streams of tears flow from my eyes, for your law is not obeyed.

data.prayer: Lord, like in the church of Antioch, where you gathered many prophets and teachers, please gather many prophets and teachers in the state of Marowijne, Suriname.
data.verse: Now in the church at Antioch there were prophets and teachers: Barnabas, Simeon called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen (who had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch), and Saul.

location.name: Marowijne
location.people_groups_list: Javanese, Caribbean, Hmong Njua, Indonesian, Arab, Syrian, Sikiana
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Javanese, Caribbean (76,000), Hmong Njua (2,200), Indonesian (19,000), Arab, Syrian (1,200), Sikiana (30)
